This is an interesting topic, semi famous in Texas for the abysmal Robin Hood program. Details about Robin Hood are interesting but this should be debated on a value level.
 
 Is equalization of funding desirable for it's own sake. What if it wasn't a matter of have and have-nots but a matter of have and have-mores. How important would equalization be then?

post_info.post_title: Resolved: Equalization of funds is desirable in public schools

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Resolved: Equalization of funds is desirable in public schools
